intro: Stachys elata, commonly known as tall hedge-nettle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves with a hairy texture. It produces clusters of pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Stachys elata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
